verses.text: And Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his God \add was\add* with him, and magnified him exceedingly.
Then Solomon spake unto all Israel , to the captains of thousands and of hundreds , and to the judges , and to every governor in all Israel , the chief of the fathers.

So Solomon , and all the congregation with him, went to the high place that \add was\add* at Gibeon ; for there was the tabernacle of the congregation of God , which Moses the servant of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had made in the wilderness.
But the ark of God had David brought up from Kirjath-jearim to \add the place which\add* David had prepared for it: for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.

Moreover the brasen altar , that Bezaleel the son of Uri , the son of Hur , had made , he put before the tabernacle of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and Solomon and the congregation sought unto it.\f + \fr 1.5 \ft he put: or, was there\f*

And Solomon went up thither to the brasen altar before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, which \add was\add* at the tabernacle of the congregation , and offered a thousand burnt offerings upon it. \p
¶ In that night did God appear unto Solomon , and said unto him, Ask what I shall give thee.
And Solomon said unto God , Thou hast shewed great mercy unto David my father , and hast made me to reign in his stead.

Now, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God , let thy promise unto David my father be established : for thou hast made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.\f + \fr 1.9 \ft like…: Heb. much as the dust of the earth\f*
Give me now wisdom and knowledge , that I may go out and come in before this people : for who can judge this thy people , \add that is so\add* great ?

And God said to Solomon , Because this was in thine heart , and thou hast not asked riches , wealth , or honour , nor the life of thine enemies , neither yet hast asked long life ; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people , over whom I have made thee king :

Wisdom and knowledge \add is\add* granted unto thee; and I will give thee riches , and wealth , and honour , such as none of the kings have had that \add have been\add* before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like. \p
¶ Then Solomon came \add from his journey\add* to the high place that \add was\add* at Gibeon to Jerusalem , from before the tabernacle of the congregation , and reigned over Israel.
And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen : and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots , and twelve thousand horsemen , which he placed in the chariot cities , and with the king at Jerusalem.

And the king made silver and gold at Jerusalem \add as plenteous\add* as stones , and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that \add are\add* in the vale for abundance.\f + \fr 1.15 \ft made: Heb. gave\f*

And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt , and linen yarn : the king’s merchants received the linen yarn at a price.\f + \fr 1.16 \ft Solomon…: Heb. the going forth of the horses which was Solomon’s\f*

And they fetched up , and brought forth out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred \add shekels\add* of silver , and an horse for an hundred and fifty : and so brought they out \add horses\add* for all the kings of the Hittites , and for the kings of Syria , by their means.\f + \fr 1.17 \ft means: Heb. hand\f*
